Core classesÂ¶

Module name: openqml.core

The Optimizer class is based on MLtoolbox by Maria Schuld.

class openqml.core.Optimizer(cost_func, cost_grad, weights, *, n_data=0, **kwargs)[source]Â¶

Quantum circuit optimizer.

Optimization hyperparameters are given as keyword arguments.

Parameters:
  • cost_func (callable) â Cost/error function. Typically involves the evaluation of one or more QNode instances representing variational quantum circuits. Takes two arguments: weights (array[float]) and optionally a batch of data item indices (Sequence[int]).
  • cost_grad (callable) â Gradient of the cost/error function with respect to the weights. Takes the same argumets as cost_func. Typically obtained using autograd as cost_grad = autograd.grad(cost_func, 0).
  • weights (array[float]) â initial values for the weights/optimization parameters
  • n_data (int) â total number of data samples to be used in training
Keyword Arguments:
 
  • optimizer (str) â âSGDâ or any optimizer not requiring a Hessian, compatible with scipy.optimize.minimize(): âNelder-Meadâ, âPowellâ, âCGâ, âBFGSâ, âL-BFGS-Bâ, âTNCâ, âSLSQPâ
  • lambda (float) â regularization strength
  • regularizer (None, callable) â None, âL2â, or a custom function mapping Sequence[float] to float.
  • init_learning_rate (float) â SGD only: initial learning rate, usually around 0.1
  • decay (float) â SGD only: decay rate for the learning rate
  • batch_size (None, int) â SGD only: How many randomly chosen data samples to include in computing the cost function each iteration. None means all of them.
  • print_every (int) â add a status entry into the log every print_every iterations
_cost_func = NoneÂ¶

callable â scalar function to be minimized

_cost_grad = NoneÂ¶

callable â gradient of _cost_func

int â total number of data samples to be used in training

bool â flag, stop optimization

Stochastic Gradient Descent optimization.

Parameters:

  • max_steps (int) â maximum number of iterations for the algorithm
